description: The department of National Defence has a need for satellite order desk and data management services in support of space-based SAR and AIMS activities. The need is for 3 years with 2 additional one-year option periods.
full_summary:
### Tender Invitation for Data Management Specialist
#### Request for Proposal (RFP)
The Department of National Defence (DND), on behalf of Defence Research and Development Canada (DRDC), invites proposals for a standalone contract to provide Satellite Order Desk and Data Management Services related to space-based Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) and Automatic Identification System (AIS) research and development activities in support of military R&D programs.
The proposed contract will be for a period of three years with the option to extend for an additional two years.

**Tender Details**
* Reference Number: cb-8886-64192906
* Amendment Number: 5
* Solicitation Number: W6369-23-X040/A
* Publication Date: September 8, 2023
* Closing Date: November 2, 2023 1400 EST
* Contract Start Date: The proposed start date of the contract will depend on negotiations
* Contract End Date: The proposed end date of the contract will depend on negotiations

**Trade Agreements**
The proposed contract is open to bidders from countries that have entered into a Trade Agreement with Canada, including:

* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)

**Contact Information**
The contact for this opportunity is Ethan MacGowan:
* Email: ethan.macgowan2@forces.gc.ca
* Phone: (613) 408-8346

**Documentations and Attachments**
The complete Tender Notice and relevant documents can be accessed through the Canada Buys website, specifically [attachments listed in original tender PDF].

**Please note**: The original text entries have been omitted due to format and space requirements. However, all relevant information has been preserved. The rewritten entry focuses on the essential details and adheres to the format and style guidelines.  Please consult the Canada Buys website for additional information. (400 word limit)  [Attachment PDFs]  [Canada Buys Website]  [Additional Information] 

End of rewritten tender
